characters: MOM'S JOY / MOM'S FEAR / MOM'S DISGUST
MOM'S JOY / MOM'S SADNESS / MOM'S FEAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A newborn baby swaddled in a blanket, held by her parents Push in... and ZOOM IN TO HER HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the blackness steps a glowing figure. This is JOY. room is black except for a bright CONSCIOUSNESS SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hmm? In front of Joy is a single large BUTTON. She pushes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby gurgles and wiggles happily.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And there she was...

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Hello, Riley.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Oh look at you. Aren’t you a little bundle of joy? A GOLDEN GLOWING SPHERE rolls from behind the screen. It’ MEMORY of what we just saw: Mom and Dad cooing at Riley.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Whoa.  INSIDE OUT 2. Joy rolls the memory on its track, illuminating the room. turns back to the button and pushes it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Riley gurgles happily.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It was amazing. Just Riley and me, forever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby Riley CRIES.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ...for 33 seconds. Joy looks to her side. There’s a new, droopy, blue charac touching the button.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I’m Sadness.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, hello. I’m Joy. Joy tries to muscle past Sadness to press the button.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I just... if you could... I just want to fix that. Thanks. The two struggle.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And that was just the beginning. Headquarters only got more crowded from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley, now age 3, barrels through the house pulling a wag

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: Riley’s POV as she runs through the house. Fear “supervises” Joy, who drives.  INSIDE OUT 3.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Very nice. Okay, looks like you got this. Very good, sharp turn... Riley approaches a POWER CORD on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ahh! Look out!!! No! Fear leaps to the console.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That’s Fear. He’s really good at keeping Riley safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley stops. She cautiously steps over the power cord.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Easy... we’re good! We’re good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fear memory (purple) rolls in.

dialogues.speaker: JOY/SADNESS
dialogues.text: Whew! /Nice job.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you very much. Joy jumps back into driving position.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: And we're back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley continues her sprint through the house. Suddenly she’s picked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLOP into highchair. Bib. Tray. Bowl.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Here we go. Alright, open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad lifts a spoonful of food to Riley’s mouth.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hmm. This looks new.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/SADNESS
dialogues.text: Do you think it’s safe?/What is it? ON THE SCREEN: a spoonful of broccoli. DISGUST enters.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Okay, caution! There is a dangerous smell, people. Hold on, what is that?

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This is Disgust. She basically keeps Riley from being poisoned, physically and socially.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: That is not brightly colored or shaped like a dinosaur... Hold on guys... It’s broccoli! Disgust GAGS and pulls a lever.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RILEY
dialogues.text: Yucky! Riley swats the broccoli. It flies into Dad’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disgust memory (green) rolls in.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Well, I just saved our lives. Yeah. You're welcome.  INSIDE OUT 5.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Riley, if you don’t eat your dinner, you're not going to get any dessert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGER looks up from reading his newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Wait. Did he just say we couldn’t have dessert?

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: That’s Anger. He cares very deeply about things being fair.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: So that’s how you want to play it, old man? No dessert? Oh, sure, we'll eat our dinner, right after YOU eat this! GrrrraaaAAHH!!!! Anger takes the controls as FLAMES blast out of his head. anger memory (red) rolls in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley throws a fit. Dad distracts her.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: ('flying’ the spoon) Hey, Riley, Riley, here comes an airplane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger stops screaming.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Oh, airplane. We got an airplane, everybody.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST/FEAR/SADNESS/JOY
dialogues.text: Ohh! /Ahh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad “lands” the food into Riley’s smiling mouth.  INSIDE OUT 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A happy memory (golden) rolls in. The others leave Joy alone at the console with Sadness.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And you've met Sadness. She... well, she... FLASH CUTS of Riley crying: broken toy, spilled ice cream tantrum in the supermarket, wanting out of her car seat.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I’m not actually sure what she does. And I’ve checked, there’s no place for her to go, so she’s good, we're good. It’s all great! Sadness exits. Joy turns to the wall of golden memories.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Anyway! These are Riley’s memories-- and they’re mostly happy, you’1ll notice, not to brag. She inspects one of the golden memories: Riley and her fr MEG (both age 3) going down a slide. She REWINDS it, relishing the happy moment.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But the REALLY important ones are over here. I don’t want to get too technical, but these are called CORE MEMORIES. Joy pops up the CORE MEMORY HOLDER. Inside are five inten bright golden memories.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Each one came from a super- important time in Riley’s life. Like when she first scored a goal? That was so amazing!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. MINNESOTA LAKE, WINTER
dialogues.text: Two-and-a-half-year-old Riley shoots a hockey puck across ice. She trips and accidentally scores a goal.  INSIDE OUT 7.

dialogues.speaker: MOM/DAD
dialogues.text: (cheering) Heeey! Would you look at that?! We got a future center here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A super-bright CORE MEMORY rolls in. It rolls to the Core Memory Holder. Clicking into positio a LIGHTLINE shoots out. The Emotions follow it to the bac window and watch a new ISLAND OF PERSONALITY form.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And each core memory powers a different aspect of Riley’s personality. Like Hockey Island! Five ISLANDS OF PERSONALITY float in space, miles from Headquarters, connected by LIGHTLINES -- their power sour

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Goofball Island is my personal favorite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toddler Riley runs naked from the bathroom, underpants on head, laughing wildly. Dad chases her with a towel.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Come back here, you little monkey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goofball Island activates: lights, movement, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naked Riley does the goofy dance on the sofa.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yup, Goofball is the best! Friendship Island is pretty good too. Joy looks at FRIENDSHIP ISLAND.  INSIDE OUT 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley and Meg walk leg over leg, arms linked, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy inspects Honesty Island.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Oh, I love Honesty Island! And that's the truth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guilty Riley stands by a broken plate. She reveals a HAMMER from behind her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy examines Family Island.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And, of course, Family Island is amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family decorate cookies together. Riley stuffs one in Dad's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emotions look out over the Islands of Personality.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The point is, the Islands of Personality are what make Riley... Riley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley splashes in the bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RILEY
dialogues.text: Look out, mermaid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley climbs the couch. She looks at the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy projects an IMAGINATION of LAVA onto the screen.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RILEY
dialogues.text: Lava! Riley jumps from couch to chair to avoid the lava.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley draws. Pull back to reveal she’s drawing on the wal

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG RILEY
dialogues.text: (singing) Who’s your friend who likes to play? Bing Bong, Bing Bong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six-year-old Riley skates across the ice backwards.

dialogues.speaker: MOM/DAD
dialogues.text: Hey! Very nice! Where did you learn that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy skates around the room, in sync with Riley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley and Meg slurp frozen drinks. Riley grimaces: ice headache!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Brain freeze! The Emotions scream as Headquarters freezes over.  INSIDE OUT 10. EXT. MINNESOTA LAKE — DAY A kids’ hockey game. Riley takes a shot and scores!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yaaay! INT. RILEY’S MINNESOTA BEDROOM - NIGHT Parents tuck Riley into bed and turn off the light.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Good night, kiddo!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: G’night, Dad. She looks up at the stars on her ceiling and falls asleep

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy watches the screen go DARK. She inspects the shelves mostly populated with GOLDEN MEMORIES.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: And... we’re out. That’s what I’m talking about: another perfect day! Nice job everybody! Let’s get those memories down to Long Term. Joy pulls a lever. Memories cascade down the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: All right, we did not die today! I call that an unqualified success. The memories pachinko down the shelves and up a tube. Joy runs to the back window to watch them glide through the distant tubes towards Long-Term Memory like falling stars

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And that’s it! We love our girl. She's got great friends and a great house. Things couldn’t be better. After all, Riley’s 11 now. What could happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving sign: Sold!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wha...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! A packed car hatchback closes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VROOM! A moving van drives away.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: OK, not what I had in mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS: the family car drives across America. car passes corn fields and rolling hills.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: Riley sleeps in the back seat. The car zips around a mountain curve, down a desert highway. Riley looks out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car emerges from a tunnel onto the GOLDEN GATE BRIDGE

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: The car drives across the bridge. Riley looks out the win

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hey look! The Golden Gate Bridge! Isn’t that great?! It’s not made out of solid gold like we thought, which is kind of a disappointment, but still! The car drives past the Ferry Building.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: I sure am glad you told me earthquakes are a myth, Joy. Otherwise I’d be terrified right now! Everyone eyes each other behind Fear’s back.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Uh... yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is stuck in traffic. Cars HONK and people YELL.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: These are my kind of people!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: All right, just a few more blocks. We’re almost to our new house!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Step on it, Daddy! 12.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Why don't we just live in this smelly car? We've already been in it forever.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Which, actually, was really lucky, because that gave us plenty of time to think about what our new house is going to look like! Let’s review the top five daydreams. Joy plugs in DAYDREAMS showing fantasy houses: tree water-slide house, etc.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Ooh! That looks safe!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ohh, this is will be great for Riley! Oh, no, no, no, THIS one. A gingerbread house.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ugh, Joy. For the last time, she cannot live in a cookie. A castle.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: THAT’S the one! It comes with a dragon!

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now we're getting close, I can feel it. Here it is, here’s our new house... and... The car stops and Riley steps out. house, REVEAL: a run-down Victorian. Nothing like the daydreams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks slackjawed.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s nice on the inside. 13.  INSIDE OUT 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley steps inside. The room is dark, dusty, uninviting.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're supposed to live here?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Do we have to?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, it smells like something died in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disgust memory rolls in.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Can you die from moving?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Guys, you’re overreacting. Nobody is dying--

dialogues.speaker: A DEAD MOUSE
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN: A dead mouse in the corner. DISGUST (0.S.) (CONT’D) I’m gonna be sick...

dialogues.speaker: ANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Great, this is just great.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Abhhhh!! It’s the house of the dead! What are we gonna do?! We’re gonna get rabies!!! Fear jumps into Anger’s arms. Anger fires up the flames.

dialogues.speaker: GET OFFA ME
dialogues.text: Fear runs around on fire. Joy puts him out with a fire extinguisher.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, hey, all through the drive Dad talked about how cool our new room is. Let’s go check it out!  INSIDE OUT 15.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/ANGER/DISGUST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're right, Joy/Yeah!/That’s right!/Yes, yes, yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley dashes up the stairs. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS It’s tiny. Depressing.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/DISGUST/ANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no, no./I’m starting to envy the dead mouse./Get out the rubber ball, we're in solitary confinement.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh, Riley can’t live here.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER FEAR
dialogues.text: She's right. Really bad.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST ANGER
dialogues.text: It’s the worst. It’s This house stinks. absolutely the worst. Memories roll in: anger, disgust, fear.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s nothing our butterfly curtains couldn’t fix. I read somewhere that an empty room is an opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Where did you read that?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. I read it and it’s great. We’ll put the bed there. And the desk over there... Joy projects an IMAGINATION of Riley’s furniture.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: The hockey lamp goes there...  INSIDE OUT 16.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER DISGUST
dialogues.text: Put the chair there. Well, the trophy collection goes there.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS FEAR
dialogues.text: Posters... Stars! I like that.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Now we're talking! Let’s go get our stuff from the moving van!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley dashes down the stairs as Mom and Dad enter the hou Dad is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Alright. Goodbye. (hangs up; to Mom) Well, guess what? The moving van won’t be here until Thursday.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: The van is lost?! This is the worst day ever! ON THE SCREEN: Mom and Dad ARGUE.

dialogues.speaker: MOM DAD
dialogues.text: You said it would be here I know that’s what I said. yesterday! That’s what they told me!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad are stressed out!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/ANGER/DISGUST/SADNESS
dialogues.text: They’re arguing!/What are we going to do?/This is so stressful. /What is their problem? Joy runs to storage and grabs what looks to be a LIGHTBUL

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’ve got a great idea! She clicks the IDEA into the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley's face lights up. Riley grabs her hockey stick. Put wad of paper in play.

dialogues.speaker: MOM DAD
dialogues.text: Did you even read the Honey, you act like this is contract? my fault--

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Andersen makes her move. She's closing in!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (grabbing a broom) Hey! Oh, no you’re not!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: She's lining up for the shot!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Coming behind you! Watch out! She slides past him. Knocks the “puck” into the fireplace

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: She shoots and she scores! Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emotions cheer. Out the back window, Family Island ru

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (taunting Mom) Come on, Grandma!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Ha! “Grandma?”

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Uh-oh, she put her hair up, we’re in for it! 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all play hockey, Mom using a pillow to guard the “go Dad picks her up to shoot past her.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (laughing) Woo! Hey, put me down! Dad scoops up Riley, too. Riley giggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A happy memory rolls in. Joy’s back in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad’s cell phone beeps.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Ugh. Sorry, hold on, hold on. (answers ) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait. Wha--?

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You're kidding. All right. Stall for me, I'll be right there. (hangs up) The investor’s supposed to show up on Thursday, not today! I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy is disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: It's okay. We get it. 18.  INSIDE OUT 19.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: You're the best. Thanks, Hon. (to Riley, as he leaves) See you, Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Dad just left us.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh, he doesn’t love us anymore. That’s sad. I should drive, right? JOY BLOCKS HER.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joy? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Uh, just uh, gimme one second... You know what I’ve realized? Riley hasn’t had lunch! (takes a memory off the wall and plays it) Remember? MEMORY: A PIZZA SHOP.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Hey I saw a pizza place down the street. Maybe we could try that?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Pizza sounds delicious!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/ANGER/DISGUST
dialogues.text: Yeah!/Pizza!/Good idea, Joy. Joy smiles.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PIZZA PLACE
dialogues.text: Riley and Mom get their pizza. On it: broccoli.  INSIDE OUT 20.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/JOY/DISGUST
dialogues.text: What the HECK IS THAT?!/Who puts broccoli on pizza?/That’s it. I’m done.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Congratulations, San Francisco, you've ruined pizza! First the Hawaiians, and now YOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and Riley walk home. Riley looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: What kind of a pizza place only serves one kind of pizza? Must be a San Francisco thing, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy glances at the wall of multi-colored memories. She si things are not going well.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Still, it’s not as bad as the soup at that diner in Nebraska.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. The spoon stood up in the soup by itself! That was disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy looks out the back window. Family Island is going.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh good. Family is running.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: The drive out was pretty fun, huh? What was your favorite part?  INSIDE OUT 21.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Spitting out the car window!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Definitely not when Dad was singing.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Wearing a seat belt!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What about the time with the dinosaur! Joy pulls up a memory.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS /FEAR/ANGER/DISGUST
dialogues.text: Yeah./Yup./That’s the one. ON THE SCREEN: Riley and Mom pose in front of a roadside cement dinosaur in Vernal, Utah.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Say cheese! Behind Dad, the car rolls down the hill. No brakes!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Dad! Dad! Look behind you.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Honey. The car! The car!

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: Hold still. Huh? (runs off after the car) Stoooop! No no no nononono!! Stegosaurus tail through the back window. The family laug Enjoying the memory, Joy and the others chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Nice one, Joy.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (smiling) I liked that time at the dinosaur. That was pretty funny.  INSIDE OUT 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy's cheer is cut short when the dinosaur memory TURNS B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley’s smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait. What? What happened? Joy looks back. Sadness is touching the memory.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: She did something to the memory. Joy tries to fix the memory.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What did you do?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I just touched it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: That shouldn’t make it change.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Change it back, Joy! Joy rubs it, but the memory stays blue.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m trying.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: You can’t change it back?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No, I guess I can’t!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Good going Sadness. Now when Riley thinks of that moment with Dad, she’s gonna feel sad. Bravo.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Joy... I don’t really know-- I thought maybe, if you-- if I-- if... I mean...

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Joy, we've got a stairway coming up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley runs towards a stairway and handrail.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Just don’t touch any other memories until we figure out what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (stepping up to controls) Alright. Get ready, this is a monster railing, and we are riding it all the way down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley sits on the railing, ready to slide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy looks back: GOOFBALL ISLAND is whirring like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley goes to slide... but hops off and walks down instea

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait, what? What happened? Suddenly a CORE MEMORY ROLLS up to Joy’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: A core memory!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh no! 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the back window, GOOFBALL ISLAND GOES DARK. Joy rushe the Core Memory Holder.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sadness! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: It looked like one was crooked so I opened it and then it fell out! Joy pops the memory back in. GOOFBALL ISLAND comes back o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley jumps back on the railing and slides down.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Woo hoo!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: It’s just that... I wanted to maybe hold one. She reaches out to touch one, AND IT STARTS TO GO BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Joy pushes Sadness away before she can touch it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa! The core memory TURNS BACK TO YELLOW.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sadness! You nearly touched a core memory. And when you touch them, we can’t change them back!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I know. I’m sorry. Something’s wrong with me. It’s like I’m having a breakdown.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You are not having a breakdown. It's stress. 24.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I keep making mistakes like that. I’m awful...

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Nooo, you’re not.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: ».+-and annoying.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Well... uh... You know what? You can’t focus on what’s going wrong. There’s always a way to turn things around, to find the fun!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Find the fun. I don’t know how to do that. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay. Well, try think of something funny!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh! Remember the funny movie where the dog dies?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s not... (tries another approach) What about that time with Meg, when Riley laughed so hard milk came out of her nose? I mean come on... INSERT: Riley spitting milk out of her nose, Meg laughing

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah, that hurt. It felt like fire.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, don’t think of that. Let’s try something else. What are your favorite things to do?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: My favorite? Um, well, I like it when we're outside.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: That's good! Like there’s the beach and sunshine... Oh! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Like that time we buried Dad in the sand up to his neck? INSERT: Riley at beach, Dad buried in sand.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I was thinking more like rain. INSERT: Riley stands in a downpour.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Rain? Rain... is my favorite too! We can stomp around in puddles... INSERT: Riley happily jumps through puddles.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s cool umbrellas, lightning storms...

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: More like when the rain runs down our back and makes our shoes soggy. And we get all cold and shivery... INSERT: Riley’s shoes fill with water. She looks miserabl

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: .--and everything just starts feeling droopy... Sadness melts to the floor, crying.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, hey... easy. Why are you crying? That’s really the opposite of what we're going for here.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Crying helps me slow down and obsess over the weight of life's problems.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ugh, you know what? Let’s think about something else. How about we read some mind manuals, huh? Sounds fun! She drags Sadness over to a shelf of technical manuals.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I’ve read most of them. 26.  INSIDE OUT 27.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Well have you read this one? This seems interesting: “Long-Term Memory Retrieval, Volume 47?”

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ohhh! A real page turner!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: (opens manual; reads) “Long-Term Memory Data Selection via channel sub-grouping?”

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: See? Fun already! You lucky dog, you're reading these cool things and I gotta go work. Life is so unfair. Joy walks away. But just as she thinks things are handled DING! Another memory -- Disgust -- slides in. Joy groans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley hops down the stairs towards the living room.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) What can we do? We’ve only got capital to last a month, maybe two. If we can't find investors by then, we're going to have to lay people off. Riley hears the stress in Dad’s voice.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Mom! Dad! Come kiss me g’night!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Be right there!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (on phone) I know, I know! We’ve got to land this, okay? Riley heads back upstairs.  INSIDE OUT 28. INT. RILEY’S ROOM —- MOMENTS LATER Riley climbs into her sleeping bag.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Did you hear Dad? He sounded really upset. INT. RILEY’S ROOM STRANGE NOISES from outside. Headlights cast shadows on t wall. Riley looks scared.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: What was that? Was it a bear? It’s a bear!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: There are no bears in San Francisco!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: I saw a really hairy guy. He looked like a bear.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m so jumpy, my nerves are shot!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Ew, I don’t want to hear about your nerves!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: I‘1l tell you what it is. This move has been a bust.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: That's what I’ve been telling you guys! There are at least 37 things for Riley to be scared of right now!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: The smell alone is enough to make her gag.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: I can’t believe Mom and Dad moved us here!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Look, I get it. You guys have concerns. But we’ve been through worse! Tell you what: let’s make a list of all the things Riley should be HAPPY about!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Fine. Let’s see... this house stinks, our room stinks...

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Pizza is weird here...

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Our friends are back home...

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: And all of our stuff is in the missing van!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh c’mon, it could be worse...

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Yeah, Joy. We could be lying on the dirty floor. In a bag. INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley is lying on the dirty floor in a sleeping bag.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay, I admit it, we had a rough start. But think of all the good things that--

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: No, Joy. There’s absolutely no reason for Riley to be happy right now. Let us handle this.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: I say we skip school tomorrow and lock ourselves in the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: We have no clean clothes. I mean, no one should see us.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah, we could cry until we can’t breathe.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: We should lock the door and scream that curse word we know. It’s a good one!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Now hold on! Look, we all have our off days. You know, I-- ON THE SCREEN: Mom opens Riley’s bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Hi honey.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: The Mom Bad News Train is pulling in! Toot toot! INT. RILEY’S ROOM Mom sits next to Riley.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Still no moving van. Now they’re saying it won't be here ‘til Tuesday, can you believe it?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Toot toot toot! INT. RILEY’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Where’s Dad?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: On the phone. This new venture is keeping him pretty busy. Your dad's a little stressed -- you know, about getting his new company up and running...  INSIDE OUT 31.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: I rest my case! Joy sighs. She falls back from the controls. Anger steps to the console. ANGER (CONT’D) Now for a few well-placed withering scowls. INT. RILEY’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I guess all I really want to say is: thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Huh? Anger drops the controls. INT. RILEY’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You know, through all this confusion you've stayed... well, you've stayed our happy girl! Mom brushes Riley’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your dad’s under a lot of pressure. But if you and I can keep smiling, it would be a big help. We can do that for him, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy, smiling with renewed purpose, steps back to the cons

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Whoa! Well.  INSIDE OUT 32. INT. RILEY’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah! Sure.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: What did we do to deserve you? (kisses Riley) Sweet dreams.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Well, you can’t argue with Mom. “Happy” it is.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR DISGUST
dialogues.text: Team Happy! Sounds great! I'm totally behind you, Joy. INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley goes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen goes black.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Looks like we’re going into REM. I got Dream Duty, so I’ll take care of sending these to Long Term. Great day today, guys! Sleep well

dialogues.speaker: TEAM HAPPY
dialogues.text: The team heads off to bed. Harp music plays.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alright, what's on tonight, Dream Production? ON THE SCREEN: a DREAM COMES UP. The family FLIES happily through the air in the car. They land in front of the house--  INSIDE OUT 33.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Well, this is it. The new place. -- except it’s haunted! Organ music. Ghosts howling. The mouse rises up into frame.

dialogues.speaker: MOUSE
dialogues.text: Come live with me, Riley! The mouse falls over, dead. A bear enters, holding a pizz

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA BEAR
dialogues.text: Somebody order a broccoli pizza? The pizza slices hop up and dance a jig.

dialogues.speaker: PIZZA SLICE
dialogues.text: Eat me! I’m organic! INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley frowns in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ah, NO, who is in charge of programming down there?! I know I’m not supposed to do this, but... Joy ducks behind the console and REBOOTS it. The dream en INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley still looks troubled.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We are not going to end the day like this. Joy has a thought. She recalls a memory. ON THE SCREEN: Riley ice skates with her parents. Joy watches, loving this kid. She shadows Riley, “skating around headquarters.  INSIDE OUT 34.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you worry. I’m gonna make sure that tomorrow is another great day. I promise. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley SMILES in her sleep. INT. KITCHEN —- MORNING Riley excitedly snarfs down breakfast cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy plays the accordion around Headquarters. The others appear, looking grumpy. Joy yells over the noise.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hello! Did I wake you?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: DO you have to play that?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Well, I have to practice. And I don't think of it as playing so much as hugging. She tosses aside the accordion and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, first day of school! Very, very exciting! I was up late last night figuring out a new plan. Here it is. (to Fear) Fear! I need a list of all the possible negative outcomes on the first day at a new school.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Way ahead of you there. Does anyone know how to spell “meteor?”

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Disgust! Make sure Riley stands out today... but also blends in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOOT TooT! 35.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: When I’m through, Riley will look so good the other kids will look at their own outfits and barf.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (addressing herself) Joy! Yes Joy? You'll be in charge of the console, keeping Riley happy all day long. And may I add I love your dress, it’s adorable. Oh, This ol’ thing? Thank you so much, I love the way it twirls... A TRAIN rushes by outside.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Train of Thought! Right on schedule. The engineer waves from the cab and drops off a large bag

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Anger! Unload the daydreams. I ordered extra in case things get slow in class.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Might come in handy, if this new school is full of boring useless classes, which it probably will be... Sadness walks by. Joy stops her.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh - Sadness! I have a super important job just for you.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Mmm-hmmm. Follow me.

dialogues.speaker: THE BACK OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Joy draws a chalk circle on the floor around Sadness’s feet.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (finishing the circle) And... there. Perfect. This is the circle of Sadness. Your job is to make sure that all the Sadness stays inside of it.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: So... you want me to just stand here?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s not MY place to tell you how to do your job. Just make sure-- (nudging Sadness’ foot back over the line) --ALL the Sadness stays in the circle. Sadness stands there.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See? You're a pro at this! Isn’t this fun?!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (heading to the console) Atta girl. Alright everyone, fresh start! We are gonna to have a good day, which will turn into a good week, which will turn into a good year, which turns into a good LIFE! INT. SAN FRANCISCO HOUSE —- MORNING Mom helps Riley on with her backpack. Dad is on the phone

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: So, the big day! New school, new friends, huh?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I know! I’m kinda nervous, but I’m mostly excited! How do I look? Do you like my shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy looks back at Family Island, working away.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Very cute! You gonna be okay? You want us to walk with you?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad? With us in public? No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (operating console) I’m on it.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Nope, I’m fine. Bye Mom! Bye Dad!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (covering phone) Have a good day at school, Monkey! All three make monkey sounds at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goofball Island works out the back window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley giggles as she exits.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Have a great day, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks up to her new school. New kids everywhere. hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you sure we want to do this?

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (0.S8.)
dialogues.text: In we go! 37. She  INSIDE OUT 38.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okayyy! Going in! Yes. Riley perks up and walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley sits at her desk and looks at the other kids in cla

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay, we've got a group of cool girls at 2 o'clock.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Double ears pierced, infinity scarf... A group of makeup-wearing girls look back at Riley.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Whoa. Is she wearing eye shadow?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Yeah, we want to be friends with them.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Let’s go talk to ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?? We’re not TALKING to them, we want them to like us.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh! (then) Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: (drops a giant stack of paper on the console) Almost finished with the potential disasters. Worst scenario is either quicksand, spontaneous combustion, or getting called on by the teacher. So as long as none of those happen...  INSIDE OUT 39.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Okay, everybody. We have a new student in class today.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?! Out of the gate? This is not happening!

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Riley would you like to tell us something about yourself?

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Nooooooo! Pretend we can’t speak English!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I got this. Joy pushes a lever.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Uhh... okay. My name is Riley Andersen. I’m from Minnesota. And now I live here.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: And how about Minnesota?... Can you tell us something about it? Well you certainly get a lot more snow than we do.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (laughs) She’s hilarious! She turns a lever.  INSIDE OUT 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley smiles, in spite of all the eyes on her.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it gets pretty cold. The lake freezes over, and that’s when we play hockey. I’m on a great team. We're called the Prairie Dogs. My friend Meg plays forward. My Dad's the coach. Pretty much everyone in my family skates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy recalls a MEMORY: the family skating together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley “watches” the memory, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: It’s a kind of family tradition. We go out on the lake almost every weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy smiles. Then, mysteriously, the IMAGE TURNS BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley's smile fades, her brow furrows.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Or we did, ‘til I moved away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Joy looks around.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/DISGUST/ANGER
dialogues.text: Huh?/Hey, what gives?/What?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey-- She spots Sadness, who is guiltily touching the memory.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sadness! You touched a memory?! We talked about this.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I know. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Get back in your circle. (trying to eject memory) Gnnh! What’s going on? Why won’t it eject?!! She fiddles with the console, but the blue memory won’t m

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Get it out of there, Joy!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (sniffling) We used to play tag and stuff...

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Cool kids whispering at 3 o'clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other kids whisper and stare.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Did you see that look?!? They're judging us!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh no. Joy tries pulling the memory. Anger, Fear and Disgust hel

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody help me. Grab that... everybody... They pull with all their might, but the memory’s not budg 41.  INSIDE OUT 42.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: But everything’s different now. Since we moved... TEARS stream down Riley’s face.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Oh no! We’re CRYING AT SCHOOL!!! Joy turns to the console. SADNESS IS DRIVING.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? No! Sadness, what are you doing? Joy finally yanks the memory out. She runs to the console pulls Sadness away from the controls.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh no, I'm sorry... I... oh... PING! A memory is created. BRIGHT BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: It’s a core memory!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: But it’s blue! The bright blue core memory rolls through the memory shel and STARTS TOWARDS THE CORE MEMORY HOLDER!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No wait... stop it! No! Ahh! Joy leaps to the holder and pops it open, preventing the blue core memory from going in. Joy grabs it. She pushes the end-of-day “memory flush” button. The tube comes down from the ceiling.  INSIDE OUT 43.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: (trying to take her memory back from Joy) Joy, no. That’s a core memory, Joy!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey! Stop it. Let go. As they struggle, they bump into the Core Memory Holder, KNOCKING ALL OF THE CORE MEMORIES OUT onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR/DISGUST/ANGER FEAR
dialogues.text: Ahh! The core memories! Out the window, the ISLANDS OF PERSONALITY GO DARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley, her face tear-stained, looks up.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ahh! Joy tosses the blue core memory aside to collect the yell core memories. Sadness grabs the blue core memory and heads to the Core Memory Holder to plug it in. Joy lunges, knocking the blu core memory out of Sadness’s hands. It’s SUCKED UP the va tube. Joy trips backward. In the chaos a yellow core memory rol toward the tube.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, no, no, no! She reaches to grab it and gets sucked up the tube hersel along with the other core memories -- and Sadness! Fear, Anger and Disgust now stand alone in Headquarters. stunned silence as the tube retracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley sits and wipes her tears.  INSIDE OUT 44.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Thank you, Riley. I know it can be tough moving to a new place, but we're happy to have you here. Alright everyone, get out your history books and turn to chapter seven. Riley hides behind her book.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Can I say that curse word now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness scream as they rocket down the tube. Joy desperately tries to hold on to the core memories. The blue core memory is sorted to a side tube.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy lands in a bin of memories. Sadness crashes next to h

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh no... (gathering memories) One, two, three... okay, got ‘em. Wha-- where are we? Joy takes in the shelving around her.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Long-Term Memory...! Joy grabs the core memories and jumps out of the dumpster She sees GOOFBALL ISLAND, silent and dark.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goofball Island. Joy surveys the islands beyond. They’re all dark.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Hoh... Riley’s Islands of Personality. They’re ALL down! This is bad.  INSIDE OUT 45.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We-- we can fix this. We just have to get back to Headquarters, plug the core memories in, and Riley will be back to normal. Joy and Sadness hurry towards headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Riley has no core memories, no personality islands and no-- (gasp)

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wha-- What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: You! YOU’RE not in headquarters. Without you, Riley can’t be happy. We gotta get you back up there.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m coming, Riley. They set off across the bridge to Goofball Island. We see LIGHTLINE beyond it, leading towards Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley and her parents eat dinner.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: So as it turns out the green trash can is not recycling, it’s for greens. Like compost. And eggshells.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: (not really listening) Mmm.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: And the blue one is recycling. And the black one is trash. Riley pushes food around on her plate.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Riley is acting so weird. Why is she acting so weird?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: What do you expect? All the islands are down.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Joy would know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: That’s it! Until she gets back, we just do what Joy would do!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Great idea! Anger, Fear, Disgust. How are WE supposed to be happy?

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Riley. I’ve got good news!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I found a junior hockey league right here in San Francisco. And get this: try-outs are tomorrow after school. What luck, right?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Hockey?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Guys, uh, this... Here, you pretend to be Joy. Fear pushes Disgust forward. She steps up to drive.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Won't it be great to be back out on the ice?  INSIDE OUT 47.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Oh yeah, that sounds fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: What was that? That wasn’t anything like Joy.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Uh, because I’m NOT Joy.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Yeah, no kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, taken aback, eyes Riley. Zoom in to Mom's head... INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS MOM’S SADNESS Did you guys pick up on that?

dialogues.speaker: MOM'S ANGER
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: MOM'S JOY / MOM'S FEAR / MOM'S DISGUST
dialogues.text: Oh yeah/Definitely. MOM’S DISGUST Something’s wrong. MOM’S ANGER Should we ask her? MOM’S SADNESS Let’s probe. But keep it subtle, so she doesn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: So! How was the first day of school?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: She's probing us.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: I'm done. (to Fear) YOU pretend to be Joy.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: What? Uh... okay... hmm.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (nervous ) It was fine, I guess, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Oh, very smooth, that was JUST like Joy.

dialogues.speaker: MOM'S HEADQUARTERS
dialogues.text: MOM’S ANGER Something’s definitely going on. MOM’S DISGUST She’s never acted like this before. What should we do? MOM’S SADNESS We're going to find out what’s happening. But we’ll need support. Signal the husband.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN TABLE
dialogues.text: Mom clears her throat at Dad. He doesn’t notice. Zoom in Dad’s head... INT.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S HEADQUARTERS
dialogues.text: All of Dad’s emotions are watching a HOCKEY MATCH, cheeri 48.  INSIDE OUT 49.

dialogues.speaker: SPORTS ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: ...-with a nice pass over to Reeves, he comes across center ice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again Mom stares, clears her throat. Dad looks up, cluele

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S ANGER
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. She’s looking at us. (turns off the memory) What did she say?

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: What? Uh, sorry, Sir. No one was listening.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S ANGER
dialogues.text: Is it garbage night? We left the toilet seat up? What? What is it, woman, what?!? INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS MOM’S DISGUST (re: Dad on the screen) He’s making that stupid face again. MOM’S ANGER I could strangle him right now! MOM’S SADNESS Signal him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom raises her eyebrows and tilts her head towards Riley. finally gets it.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Ahh, so, Riley! How was school? INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS Mom’s Emotions give up.  INSIDE OUT 50.

dialogues.speaker: / MOM'S DISGUST
dialogues.text: You gotta be kidding me!/He really needs to start paying attention./ Is he paying attention at all?

dialogues.speaker: MOM'S ANGER
dialogues.text: For THIS we gave up that Brazilian helicopter pilot? INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Move! I’LL be Joy.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (snarky) School was great, alright?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Riley, is everything okay? Riley rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: Sir, she just rolled her eyes at us.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S ANGER
dialogues.text: What is her deal? Alright, make a show of force. I don’t want to have to put “the Foot” down.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: No. Not the Foot.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Riley, I do NOT like this new attitude. INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Oh I’1l show you attitude, old man.  INSIDE OUT 51.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: No, no, no! Stay happy! Anger shoves him away and hits a button.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What is your problem? Just leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: Sir! Reporting high levels of sass!

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S ANGER
dialogues.text: Take it to DEFCON 2. Sirens begin to BLARE.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: You heard that, gentleman. DEFCON 2.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Listen young lady, I don’t know where this disrespectful attitude came from... INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: You want a piece of this, Pops? Come and get it! Anger grasps two levers with all his might.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, well... well... INT. DAD’S HEADQUARTERS

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S ANGER
dialogues.text: Here it comes... Prepare the Foot!  INSIDE OUT 52. Dad's Emotions uncover “Launch Station” buttons, insert k

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: Keys to safety position! Ready to launch on your command, Sir! INT. RILEY’S HEADQUARTERS ANGER, flames and yell at full blast, pushes up the lever

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Just SHUT UP! Dad and Mom are shocked.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: That’s it, go to your room! Now! Riley pushes away from the table and goes upstairs in a h

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: The Foot is down! The Foot is down! They all CHEER.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S ANGER
dialogues.text: Good job gentlemen. That could have been a disaster. INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS MOM’S SADNESS Well, that was a disaster. Mom's Anger recalls a memory: the Brazilian helicopter pi

dialogues.speaker: HELICOPTER PILOT
dialogues.text: Come fly with me, gatinha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all SIGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley slams her bedroom door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, Family Island RUMBLES. Joy and Sadness have made it across Goofball Island and m now walk across the thin lightline. Below is the darkness the Memory Dump.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We’re gonna walk out there? On that?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: It’s the quickest way back.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: But it’s right over the Memory Dump. If we fall we’ll be forgotten forever!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We have to do this. For Riley. Just follow my footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Hohh... ok.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (stepping onto lightline) It's not that high. It’s totally fiii... Whoa... She loses her balance. Almost drops a memory over the sid Sadness steps out onto the lightline. They inch along. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - LATER Dad knocks on Riley’s door, peeks in.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Hey. Riley’s in her sleeping bag. She doesn’t answer. 53.  INSIDE OUT 54.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So uh, things got a little out of hand downstairs. You want to talk about it? (still no answer) Come on. Where’s my happy girl? Monkey. (he tries monkey noises)

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: He’s trying to start up Goofball. Fear looks at the empty Core Memory Holder, then out the window: GOOFBALL ISLAND is dark and silent. INT. RILEY’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Come on. (tries more monkey noises) Riley looks at Dad, but TURNS AWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goofball Island crumbles and breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy sees the lightline breaking ahead.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ahhh! Go back! RUN! RUN! RUN! They run back onto Goofball Island as the lightline crumb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness frantically outrun collapsing debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leap across the buckling bridge, making it over to t cliff just in time to see Goofball Island fall into the d  INSIDE OUT 55.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What-- ? Joy watches it sink. FLASH CUTS of Young Riley: * Riley twirling until she falls over. * The family jumping on a trampoline. * Riley riding on Dad’s shoulders, making silly faces wit ice cream all over her face. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: I get it, you need some alone time. We'll talk later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emotions stare out the back window in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: We have a major problem.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Ohh, Joy where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness stare down into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We lost Goofball Island. That means she can lose Friendship, and Hockey, and Honesty, and Family! You can fix this, right Joy?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I... I don’t know. (Sadness sighs in despair) But we have to try. C’mon. The sky darkens.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riley’s gone to sleep. (more sighs from Sadness) .»-which is a good thing, when you think about it, because nothing else bad can happen while she’s asleep! We'll be back to Headquarters before she wakes up. We’1ll just go across Friendship Island.  INSIDE OUT 56. Shelves jut out over the cliff edge, making Friendship Is inaccessible.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We’ll never make it, hoh... nooo...

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No, no, no, don’t obsess over the weight of life’s problems, remember the funny movie where the dog dies?! Sadness face plants.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Uhhh, Sadness, we don’t have time for this. She looks to her side. Memory shelves wind into the dista Joy heads off into the maze.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll just have to go around! Take the scenic route.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Wait! Joy, you could get lost in there!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Think positive!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m positive you will get lost in there. That’s Long-Term Memory. An endless warren of corridors and shelves. I read about it in the manuals. Joy stops. Sadness is right. But wait!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: The manuals? The manuals! You read the manuals!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: So you know the way back to headquarters!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I, guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy grabs Joy heads

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You are my map! Let’s go! Lead on, Mind Map! Show me where we’re going!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Okay! Only, I’m too sad to walk. Just give me a few... hours. Sadness’ leg and DRAGS her into the shelves.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Which way? Left?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Right. (Joy turns right) No. I mean, go left. I said left was right, like “correct.”

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: This actually feels kind of nice. off into the COMPLICATED LABYRINTH ahead of them.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay! Here we go. We’ll be back to Headquarters before morning. We can do it. This’ll be easy. This is working!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy, exhausted, drags Sadness through the maze of shelves

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: This is not working. Are we getting close?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just another right. And a left. Then another left, and a right...

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Are you sure you know where we’re going? Because we seem to be walking AWAY from Headquarters-- 57.  INSIDE OUT 58. The SKY BRIGHTENS. Day. And they’re still lost.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riley’s awake. Joy drops a core memory. Sadness reaches to grab it.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah ah ah, don’t touch, remember? If you touch them, they stay sad!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry. I won't... Joy looks behind her. The bottom row of memories are BLUE

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...starting now.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I can’t take much more of this.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Forget ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Mind Workers! Joy runs off toward the voice.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: But Joy we’re almost... ohhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy finds two workers vacuuming up memories from the shel

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Phone numbers. We don’t need all of these. They’re in her phone.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Just forget all of that. Please. Forget it!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Hi. I need to find Friendship Island...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: (pointing to memories) Look at this. Four years of piano lessons.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, looks pretty faded.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: You know what? Save "Chopsticks” and “Heart and Soul,” get rid of the rest. Zoop! The memories get vacuumed up.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Are you--

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: U.S. Presidents. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Eh, just keep Washington, Lincoln and the fat one.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Forget ‘em!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey! You can’t throw those away! Those are perfectly good memories.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: The names of every “Cutie Pie Princess” doll?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yes! That is critical information! Glitterstorm, Honeypants, Officer Justice...

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Forget ‘em! He vacuums up the memories behind Joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The memories shoot out a sewer pipe and fall into the darkness of the Memory Dump.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey! Bring those back.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: They're in the dump. Nothing comes back from the dump.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Yeah. Look lady, this is our job,

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: When Riley doesn’t care about a memory, it fades.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Fades?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Happens to the best of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: (pulls memory from a cart) Except for this bad boy! This one will NEVER fade.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (recognizing it) The song from the gum commercial?

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: (conspiratorial) Sometimes we send that one up to headquarters for no reason.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: It just plays in Riley’s head over and over again. Like a million times! Ha! Let’s watch it again! She rewinds it and plays it again. They sing along.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Tripledent gum will make you smile! Tripledent gum! It lasts a while! Tripledent gum will help you, mister, to punch bad breath right in the kisser.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We all know the song. Okay. Yup. Real catchy.

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: (to Female Forgetter) What do ya think? Should we do it?  INSIDE OUT 61.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: Yeah! Ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: MALE FORGETTER
dialogues.text: OK, here we go! Ha ha ha! He tips the gum memory into the inner workings of the she FWOOM! It shoots up towards Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear, Anger and Disgust are having a peaceful morning. Th memory drops into Headquarters, playing at full volume.

dialogues.speaker: GUM MEMORY
dialogues.text: Tripledent gum will make you smile! Tripledent gum! It lasts a while--

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Wha-- this again!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Forgetters walk away, laughing and singing.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (following them) Wait! Do you know how to get to Friendship Island?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley, laptop on her stomach, hums the Tripledent gum son

dialogues.speaker: MEG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (on the computer) Do you like it there? Did you feel any earthquakes? Is the bridge cool?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s good. What happened with the playoffs?

dialogues.speaker: MEG
dialogues.text: We won the first game. Coach says we might actually go to the finals this year. Oh, and we’ve got this new girl on the team. She’s so cool.  INSIDE OUT 62.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Oh, she did NOT just say that.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: A NEW GIRL? Meg has a new friend already?! Anger GROWLS.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Hey hey, stay happy! We do NOT want to lose any more islands here guys! INT. RILEY’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: MEG
dialogues.text: We can pass the puck to each other without even looking. It’s like mind reading!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: You like to read minds, Meg? I got something for you to read right here! (grabbing the controls)

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: No no no, what are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Wait, wait-- let’s just be calm for one second-- Anger snaps Fear’s nose like a rubber band. Anger slams t controls forward like a lunatic.

dialogues.speaker: GAAAAAA
dialogues.text: INT. RILEY’S ROOM

dialogues.speaker: MEG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I heard they have parrots living in-

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I gotta go.  INSIDE OUT 63.

dialogues.speaker: MEG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: I GOTTA GO.
dialogues.text: Riley slams down the computer and SCOWLS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy follows the Forgetters, trying to get directions. The ignore her, singing the gum-commercial jingle. A horrible mechanical GROANING sound. Joy reacts.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy rounds a corner and sees Friendship Island crumbling.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Friendship Island? The FRIENDSHIP CORE MEMORY Joy holds fades. She runs forw

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wh-- ? She looks on in horror as Friendship Island falls.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ohh, not Friendship. Joy hugs the core memories. One of them is memory of youn Riley and Meg walking together.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh, Riley loved that one. And now it's GONE. Goodbye friendship, hello loneliness. Joy sees Hockey Island in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (trying to stay positive) We'll just have to go the long way. They turn to look back into the deep memory shelves.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. The long, long, looong way. I’m ready. Sadness lies down on the ground, offering her leg. Joy si She doesn’t want to do this again.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ah, yes. (pulling Sadness) There’s gotta be a better way.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (talking to the memories) Ohhh, look at you, you’re a KEEPER!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Huh? Joy sees a strange figure up ahead, gathering memories.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: I will take you, but not you. (beat) Oh who am I kidding, I can’t leave you!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hello! The figure sees Joy -- and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait! Hey, wait! Stop! Joy chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LONG-TERM MEMORY DEAD END
dialogues.text: Joy rounds a corner to find the figure crouched on the ground, hiding his face in his hands like a three year ol

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Excuse me...?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: (jumping up; cornered) Ahhhh! Uh, I was looking for, uh-- (grabs a memory)

dialogues.speaker: --DIVERSION
dialogues.text: He THROWS IT and makes a run for it. 64.  INSIDE OUT 65.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ha ha! So long, sucker! He immediately crashes into a cart of memories.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ow! Oww, I hurt all over.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait. I know you.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: No you don’t. I get that a lot, I look like a lot of people.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No, I do! Bing Bong! Riley’s Imaginary Friend!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: You really DO know me!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Well of course! Riley loved playing with you, you two were best friends! Oh! You would know. We’re trying to get back to Headquarters...

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Headquarters? You guys are from Headquarters?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (mock modesty) Well, yeah. I’m Joy. This is Sadness.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: You're Joy? THE Joy?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Mm-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Well what the heck are you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: That's a good question! You want to answer that, Sadness?  INSIDE OUT 66.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Without you, Riley won’t ever be happy. We can't have that, we gotta get you back! I’11l tell you what, follow me.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bing Bong leads them on through the memory shelves.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: It is so great to see you again. I gotta tell you, I am such a huge fan of your work. Do you remember when you and Riley were in a band? FLASH CUTS of their adventures: *Riley bangs on pots and pans, Bing Bong plays his trunk.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I went to all of your concerts.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, I blow a mean nose. *Bing Bong runs on ceiling, Riley chases after him.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Watching you play tag was such a treat.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Two-time world champ. *Riley and Bing Bong sit in her wagon ("rocket").

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Oh, and remember your rocket?!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Of course! It runs on song power.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: That's right, your theme song! (singing) Who's your friend who likes to play?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: (sings)

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: His rocket makes you yell “Hooray!”

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG BING BONG
dialogues.text: Sadness eyes Bing Bong, who is a pink elephant made with cat tail.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: What exactly are you supposed to be?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: You know, it’s unclear. I’m mostly cotton candy, but shape-wise, I’m part cat, part elephant, part dolphin.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Dolphin? Bing Bong does a spot-on dolphin impression.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: You gotta remember, when Riley was three, animals were all the rage. The cow goes moo. The horse goes neigh. That’s all people talked about back then.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess that’s true. What are you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Well, there’s not much call for imaginary friends lately, so, uh, you know, I’m...

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, don’t be sad. Tell you what, when I get back up to Headquarters, I’1ll make sure Riley remembers you.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: You will?!  INSIDE OUT 68.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Of course, she’d love that!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Ha ha! This is the greatest day of my life! He launches into a jig, but hurts himself and bursts into tears. Candy pours out of his tear ducts.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: I cry candy. Try the caramel, it’s delicious.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ooo. (fumbles memories) Woah!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Oh-- here-- use this. (offers his satchel)

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Oh, hold on. Wait a second. He empties out an impossible amount of stuff: tons of memories, a boot, an anchor, a cat... Joy and Sadness sta in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? It’s imaginary. Joy accepts the satchel and puts in the core memories.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thanks! This‘’ll make it a lot easier to walk back to Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Walk? We’re not walkin’! We’re taking the Train of Thought! He points to the train speeding towards Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: The train, of course! That is so much faster! But how do we catch it?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Well, it kind of goes all over the place, but there is a station in Imaginationland. I know a short cut. Come on, this way!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’m so glad we ran into you! A giant BUILDING blocks their progress. Bing Bong opens a door. It’s dark inside.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: The station is right through here. The train station is visible through a door on the other

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: After you.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Joy...

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I read about this place in the manual. We shouldn’t go in there.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Bing Bong says it’s the quickest way to Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: No, but Joy, this is Abstract Thought.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: What’re you talking about? I go in here all the time. It’s a shortcut, see? He points to a “Danger” sign above the door.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: D-A-N-G-E-R: shortcut. I’1ll prove it to you. (he climbs in) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look at me! I’m closer to the station ‘cause I’m taking the shortcut!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Let’s go around. This way. She points: the building is huge -- it’s a long way aroun

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Almost there...! Joy looks back at Bing Bong. The station is right there.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (to Sadness) If you want to walk the long way, go for it. But Riley needs to be happy. I’m not missing that train. (walks in) Bing Bong knows what he’s doing. He's part dolphin. They're very smart.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Well, I guess... She climbs in. EXT. SCHOOL LUNCH YARD —- LUNCHTIME Riley carries her lunch tray outside. The yard is full of chatty, happy kids, but Riley finds an empty bench and ea by herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two Mind Workers approach the same door our trio entered.

dialogues.speaker: ABSTRACT WORKER
dialogues.text: Okay, what abstract concept are we trying to comprehend today?

dialogues.speaker: ABSTRACT WORKER
dialogues.text: (checking a clipboard) Um... loneliness.

dialogues.speaker: ABSTRACT WORKER
dialogues.text: Hm. Looks like there’s something in there. I’m going to turn it on for a minute and burn out the gunk.  INSIDE OUT 71. She closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: What’d I tell ya? You’1ll be at Headquarters in no time. BAM! The door closes behind them. The LIGHTS GO ON.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say, would you look at that! Around them, strange SHAPES float into space.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Whoa! What's happening?!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh no. They turned it on.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
