dialogues.text: Huh! I’ve never seen this before. Bing Bong’s head turns into a Picasso-like form. Joy and Sadness scream as they become Cubist versions of themselv

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My face! My beautiful face!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We're abstracting! There are four stages. This is the first: non- objective fragmentation!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Alright, do not panic! What is important is that we all STAY TOGETHER. His arm falls off.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ah! Joy's head falls off. Sadness’ leg goes. She topples.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We’re in the second stage: we're deconstructing!  INSIDE OUT 72.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Run! Bing Bing falls into pieces.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aaah! I can’t feel my legs! (his disassembled arm finds them) Oh, there they are.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Come here, me! They gather their pieces as they rush to the exit.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We've gotta get out of here before we're nothing but shape and color! We'll get stuck here forever!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: “Stuck?!” Why did we come in here?!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: I told you, it’s a shortcut! Though the window, the TRAIN OF THOUGHT pulls in.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: The train! POP! They change into FLAT COLOR VERSIONS of themselves.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh no... We’re two-dimensional! That’s stage three!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We're getting nowhere!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Depth! I’m lacking depth! It’s hard to move. They struggle towards the window.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Come on! Sadness and Bing Bong follow and try to squeeze through. because of the broken perspective, they are now all HUGE compared to the door.  INSIDE OUT 73.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: AUGH! We can’t fit! POP! They abstract into ABSTRACT COLORED BLOBS.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh no, we're nonfigurative. This is the last stage!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: We're not going to make it! Sadness slumps to the ground... and becomes a line!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Wait! We’re two dimensional. Fall on your face! (crawls like an inchworm)

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ooh! They follow Sadness and inch safely out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three lines land outside just as the train pulls out. They get up to go, but as lines they can barely move.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait! Stop! Stop! STOP! POP! Joy goes from non-representational to two-dimensiona She falls down flat as the train speeds off. POP! The three transform back to normal.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Bing Bong) I thought you said that was a shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: I did, but wow, we should NOT have gone in there. That was dangerous! They really should put up a sign.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: How long till the next train?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Who knows? But don’t worry. There’s another station. That way! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (points 0.S.) The train always stops there right before it goes to Headquarters. If we hurry, we can catch it!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: This isn’t another one of your short cuts, is it?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: (laughing exuberantly) Yeah! Joy skeptically watches him head off.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (to Sadness) Is there really another station?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Through there. Bing Bong leads them towards the impressive gates of...

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Welcome to Imaginationland!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Imaginationland?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Sure! I come here all the time. I’m practically the mayor. Hey, you guys hungry? There’s French Fry Forest! (starts eating) Nom nom nom, delicious! Joy is loving this.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Check it out! Trophy Town! Medals! Ribbons! Everyone’s a winner! Bing Bong kicks a soccer ball into a giant goal and worke appear out of nowhere to shower him with awards.  INSIDE OUT 75.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I won first place! Workers give Joy a medal and Sadness a ribbon.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Me too!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Hohh... Participation award...

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait, is that-- Sadness, look, it’s Cloud Town! That is my favorite! Joy rips off a chunk of cloud and floats up into the air.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's so soft! Joy jumps down and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Woah! Let me try! Bing Bong rips off some cloud. A CLOUD MAN emerges from t house, angry.

dialogues.speaker: CLOUD MAN
dialogues.text: Hey! What's the big idea? You'd better fix that wall, or else you're in big troub-- POOF! Bing Bong blows the Cloud Man away and walks off nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Bing Bong gleefully jump between couch cushions.

dialogues.speaker: JOY BING BONG
dialogues.text: Oh no, lava! Whooo! Whawhoooo! Imaginationland is the best! Sadness tries to jump to a rock, barely makes it.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Is it all going to be so interactive?  INSIDE OUT 76.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Hey, look! The House of Cards!! Ooh, wait, hang on just a minute... From a nearby garage made of cards, Bing Bong pulls a wag

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Your rocket!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Yeah! I stashed it in there for safekeeping. Now I’m all set to take Riley to the MOON! He gestures proudly -- accidentally knocking over the hou

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE OF CARDS WORKER
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I love Imaginationland!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Isn't it great? And there’s always something new, like... A giant machine. A conveyer belt reveals a handsome teena

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who the heck is that?

dialogues.speaker: BOYFRIEND GENERATOR WORKER
dialogues.text: Imaginary Boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGINARY BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: I would die for Riley. Joy grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen him before.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGINARY BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: I live in Canada.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Anyway. This way, through Preschool World! We’re nearly to the train!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Riley, here we come!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and Riley sit on the bleachers.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: This should be fun. New team, new friends! These kids look pretty good -- considering they're from San Francisco. Heh heh!

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY COACH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Okay Andersen, you're up!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I gotta go. Riley heads onto the ice.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Okay. Good luck, sweetie!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Luck isn’t gonna help us now. If she tries to use Hockey Island, it’s going down.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Which is why I’ve recalled every hockey memory I can think of. The Emotions are standing ankle deep in memories.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One of these has got to work in place of the core memory. O.S. Hockey whistle.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER/DISGUST
dialogues.text: She’s about to play!/Hurry! 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear loads a memory into the core holder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley skates onto the ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the window, Hockey Island lights up feebly.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Ha ha! We did it gang! It’s working-- BOOM! The Core Memory Holder ejects a memory, slamming An in the face. Hockey Island shakes. Fear SHRIEKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley struggles to dribble the puck.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY COACH
dialogues.text: Line change! Line change! Change it up! Change it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear frantically loads memories into the Holder, which sp them out like dodge balls. Disgust and Anger run for cove The Holder spins furiously, flinging Fear against the win Memories pelt him.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: (hiding behind a sofa) It’s like we don't learn anything.

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY COACH
dialogues.text: Let’s pick it up out there! Riley attempts to slap the puck, misses, and TRIPS.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: That’s it! 78.  INSIDE OUT 79.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: No, no, no, breathe! Find your happy place-- Anger grabs Fear by the neck and ricochets him off the console, then furiously takes the controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley angrily throws her stick to the ice and skates off. The other players stop and watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom stands up, concerned. Riley heads to the stands and removes her skates.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Riley, what’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You're not going to finish tryouts?

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: What’s the point?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Hey, it’1ll be alright. Let’s just--

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Stop saying everything will be alright! Riley stomps towards the exit. She looks back at the rink All the players cheer and high five. Riley turns away from the rink and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom! Joy turns around and watches Hockey Island crumble.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hockey? Oh no... no, she loves hockey. She can’t give up hockey. Joy pulls out the HOCKEY CORE MEMORY: Riley’s first goal.  INSIDE OUT 80.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Bing Bong, we have to get to that station.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Sure thing. This way, just past Graham Cracker Castle. Hey. That’s weird. Graham Cracker Castle used to be right here. I wonder why they moved it? He walks on, concerned, LEAVING HIS WAGON BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow, that’s not... I would have sworn Sparkle Pony Mountain was right here. Hey, what’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I dunno, we’ll have to come back--

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Princess Dream World! A wrecking ball hits a pink castle. Glitter dust plumes.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no! The Stuffed Animal Hall of Fame! RIIIP! The head of a bear comes off. Too late, Bing Bong notices some construction workers CARRYING AWAY HIS ROCKE

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My rocket! (running after them) Wait! Riley and I, we’re still using that rocket! It still has some song power left!! (sings) Who's your friend who likes to play? THE ROCKET RESPONDS weakly, propelling it forward. The workers toss it onto a junk pile. A bulldozer pushes the towards the CLIFF EDGE.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nooo!!! No! No! No! You can’t take my rocket to the dump! Riley and I are going to the MOON! Ahhh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over it goes, into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riley can’t be done with me. Bing Bong sits, stunned. Joy approaches gingerly.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s going to be okay. We can fix this! We just need to get back to Headquarters. Which way to the train station?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: (still stunned) I had a whole trip planned for us. Joy tries another tactic.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey, who’s ticklish, huh? Here comes the tickle monster... No response.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Bing Bong, look at this! Dohoioih! She makes a silly face. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, here’s a fun game! You point to the train station and we all go there! Won’t that be fun? Come on, let's go to the train station! Joy walks off, attempting to lead.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: (sits beside Bing Bong) I’m sorry they took your rocket. They took something that you loved. It’s gone, forever.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness, don’t make him feel worse.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: It’s all I had left of Riley. 81.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I bet you and Riley had great adventures.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: They were wonderful. Once we flew back in time. We had breakfast twice that day.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: That’s sounds amazing. I bet Riley liked it.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Oh she did. We were best friends.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. It’s sad. 82. Bing Bong puts his head on Sadness’ shoulder and CRIES. Sadness keeps her arm around him until he’s done.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: I’m okay now. (stands) C'mon, the train station is this way. He walks off. Joy and Sadness follow.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: How did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. He was sad, so I listened to what--

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, there’s the train!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our trio climb aboard just as the train moves.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We made it! We’re finally going to get home! Twirling, she knocks over two boxes labeled “FACTS” “OPINIONS.” Small objects spill out of both. and  INSIDE OUT 83.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh no! These Facts and Opinions look so similar! He dumps them into the “FACTS” box.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Eh, don’t worry about it -- happens all the time. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley drops her gear and throws herself on her sleeping b

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: On a scale of one to ten, I give this day an F.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Well why don’t we quit standing around and DO something?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Like what, genius? Fear enters with a suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Like quitting! That’s what I’m doing. He stomps on the recall button.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sure, it’s the coward’s way out. But this coward is gonna survive! The tube drops over him, but pummels Fear with dozens of memories. The tube shuts off and retracts. Fear drops to floor in pain.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Emotions can’t quit, genius. Fear spits up a memory.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Euch! I thought we were supposed to be keeping Riley happy.  INSIDE OUT 84.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. Wait a minute! Anger runs to the back and rummages through the ideas.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah ha!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: (holds up the lightbulb) Oh nothing. Just the best idea ever.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: All the good core memories were made in Minnesota. Ergo, we go back to Minnesota and make more. Ta-da!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Wait. You’re saying we run away?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Well, I wouldn’t call it that. I'd call it, “The Happy Core Memory Development Program.”

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: You can’t be serious.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Hey. Our life was perfect until Mom and Dad decided to move to San Fran Stinktown.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: But, I mean, it’s just so drastic!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Need I remind you of how great things were there? Our room? Our back yard? Our friends? He punches up a memory. It plays on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: GUM MEMORY
dialogues.text: Tripledent gum will make you smile! Tripledent gum it lasts--  INSIDE OUT 85.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Did I ASK for the gum commercial?!?! (he ejects the memory) Anyway, it was better, that’s my point.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: (considering) Riley was happier in Minnesota...

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Wait, hold on. Shouldn’t we just sleep on this or something?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Fine. Let’s sleep on it. Because hey, I’m sure jolly fun-filled times are just around the corner. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley goes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train slows to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Huh? The engineer and his assistant hop off the engine.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey hey! Why aren’t we moving?

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN ENGINEER
dialogues.text: Riley's gone to sleep. We’re all on break.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: You mean we’re stuck here until morning?

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Yeah, the Train of Thought doesn’t run while she’s asleep.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Oh, we can’t wait that long!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: How about we wake her up?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness, that’s ridiculous. How could we possibly... She follows Sadness’ gaze and spots DREAM PRODUCTIONS.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about we wake her up!?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Great idea, Joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Thanks. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pan down from the DREAM PRODUCTIONS GATE: a busy backlot.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Whoa! This place is huge.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah, it looks so much smaller than I expected. They walk past dream “movie posters.”

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Whoa! “I Can Fly”? I love that one! Joy spots a Unicorn sitting in a director’s chair.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Rainbow Unicorn! She’s RIGHT THERE! Joy tries to play it cool as they walk past.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: My friend says you're famous. She wants your autograph.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No, no, Sadness, don't bother Miss Unicorn, okay? (to unicorn) Sorry, she’s from outta town. So embarrassing, right? She pushes Sadness away. Joy pops back in. 86.  INSIDE OUT 87.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I loved you in Fairy Dream Adventure Part 7. Okay, bye. I love you. They reach STAGE B. A sign below a red flashing light rea “DO NOT ENTER WHEN LIGHT FLASHING.”

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Huh. Wonder what that means. Oh well, let’s go in! They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers scramble to get ready for the production. A Direc distributes scripts.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Set up the classroom set! Today’s memories are in, we’ve got a lot to work with here. Riley dumped her best friend, had a miserable day at school, and quit hockey. The writers have put together a killer script! INT. STAGE B —- COSTUME AREA Joy cringes at the news as the three hide behind costumes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear enters drinking tea.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: (grumbling to self) Just because Joy and Sadness are gone, I have to do stupid dream duty... INT. STAGE B —- COSTUME AREA Joy, Sadness and Bing Bong watch from behind boxes.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay, how are we gonna wake her up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy spots She gives

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Well, she wakes up sometimes when she has a scary dream. We could scare her.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Scare her? No no, she’s been through enough already.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: But Joy--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness you may know your way around down here, but I know Riley! We’re gonna make her so happy she'll wake up with exhilaration! We'll excite her awake!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: That’s never happened before. a nearby dog costume and tosses it to Sadness.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ooh, Riley loves dogs. Put this on!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’1l1 work.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Bing Bong.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Yeah? him the satchel containing the CORE MEMORIES.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Don’t let anything happen to these.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Got it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DREAM DIRECTOR checks the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Mm hm. Add the reality distortion filter. 88.  INSIDE OUT 89. A WORKER slips a filter over the camera lens, transformin the MIND WORKERS into replicates of Riley’s classmates.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Love it. (to actors) Remember, play to the camera, everyone! Riley is the camera! Makeup, get out of there, we are on in 5,4,3... A UNION HARP PLAYER strums: the dream is starting. From the camera’s POV: the classroom set. STUDENTS at des An EXTRA playing Riley’s teacher reads cue cards badly.

dialogues.speaker: EXTRA
dialogues.text: Hello class. Before we begin today’s pop quiz, which counts for 90% of your final grade...

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Man, she is one bad actress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CUE CARD GUY flips over the next card.

dialogues.speaker: EXTRA
dialogues.text: -..I want to introduce our new student. Riley. Would you like to stand up and introduce yourself?

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Camera. The camera adjusts as if Riley is standing.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And... cue Riley. A CREW MEMBER clears his throat and reads into a megaphon

dialogues.speaker: RILEY VOICE
dialogues.text: My name’s Riley Andersen, I’m from Minnesota and now I live here. A STUDENT points to the camera.  INSIDE OUT 90.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM STUDENT
dialogues.text: Ew, look! Her teeth are falling out! A crew member drops handfuls of teeth in front of the cam

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: (dismissive) Pff, teeth falling out, I'm used to that one. Let me guess, we have no pants on.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM STUDENT
dialogues.text: Hey look! She came to school with no pants on! The camera adjusts down to reveal Riley’s bare legs. Rile hands try to block them.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Called it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness are in the dog costume, waiting to go on.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I don’t think this happy thing is going to work. But if we scare her--

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Just follow my lead. Here we go! Joy yanks Sadness onto the set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run around in playful circles. Joy makes puppy noise

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: (flipping through script) Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness run around, Joy licking students and bark Through the reality distortion they look like a happy pup Joy looks at the sleep indicator: Riley is still asleep. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Riley is sound sleep.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (to Bing Bong) Psst. You’re on! Go! Bing Bong pulls a rope. Balloons drop! A colorful backdro

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Woo! Let’s party! Let’s dance. Woo!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Hey, a party! INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley is still sound asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, Joy and Sadness run in circles, barking.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Joy, this isn’t working. Bing Bong knocks over a light, causing spooky uplighting. Sadness tries to stop. The dog costume RIPS IN HALF. 91.  INSIDE OUT 92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear does a spit take. On screen, a real dog is in two pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy runs after Sadness.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Huh? Sadness, what are you doing?! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen, the front half of a dog chases the rear half.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: It’s just a dream, it’s just a dream, it’s just a dream.. INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley stirs in her sleep.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: They're trying to wake her up! Call security!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bing Bong appears on screen.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi Riley, it’s me! Who’s your friend who likes to play? Bing Bong, Bing Bong!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Bing Bong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bing Bong slips, tipping over the set wall.  INSIDE OUT 93.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness! You are ruining this dream! You're scaring her!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: But look, it’s working! The SLEEP INDICATOR is starting to tip. Joy’s eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Whoa! But before she can do anything, Security enters.

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: (to Security) They are not part of this dream! Get them! Sadness pulls Joy out of harms way as guards GRAB Bing Bo

dialogues.speaker: DREAM PRODUCTIONS COP
dialogues.text: Stop right there!

dialogues.speaker: DREAM DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: (to camera operator) Pan away! Pan away! The camera pans away to Rainbow Unicorn making off with a giant cupcake platter from the craft services table.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Booooo! Pick a plot line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness watch as guards haul off Bing Bong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness exit Stage B.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ow! Ow! Cut that out. Ow! Please... you can’t do this! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you like candy? You look hungry. I can get you candy! Please! Ow. Ow. Ow. Joy and Sadness watch Bing Bong being dragged far off to dark, menacing entry of SUBCONSCIOUS.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: No, no no no, there go the core memories...! The door opens. SPOOKY LIGHT spills out.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: I can’t go in there. I’m scared of the dark. Please! He’s thrown in and the door SLAMS SHUT. Joy and Sadness head after him, down the long stairway.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What is this place?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: (hushed tone) The Subconscious. It’s where they take all the troublemakers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness hide. TWO CLUELESS GUARDS block the gate.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD DAVE
dialogues.text: My hat feels loose.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD FRANK
dialogues.text: Let me see. How to get in? Sadness has an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness leads Joy around and behind the guards.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD DAVE
dialogues.text: You got my hat? Or, or is that your hat?

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, it’s my hat.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: You sure? I don’t know, look label.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: Yeah, it says, “My Hat.”

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: Wait, it says, “My Hat”?

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: “My Hat,” it says.

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: in the

dialogues.speaker: DAVE
dialogues.text: That’s what I wrote in my hat.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: You’ve got my hat on.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay, but it’s my handwriting-- Sadness loudly SHAKES the door.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD
dialogues.text: Hey! You!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh! You caught us! Heh.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Get back in there! No escaping! The guards shove them through and slam the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy gives Sadness an approving nod: nice work. They head forward. This place is spooky.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I don’t like it here. It’s where they keep Riley’s darkest fears. Joy spots a dark shape ahead:  INSIDE OUT 96.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: It’s broccoli! Behind them:

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: The stairs to the basement! They SCAMPER AWAY like frightened mice.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Grandma’s vacuum cleaner! The vacuum gives chase. Joy and Sadness lose it and hide behind a rock.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (catching her breath) Okay, come on. Sadness makes a loud CRINKLING NOISE with each step.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would you walk quieter?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I’m trying!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What is going-- (looking down) Candy wrappers. They follow a trail of candy wrappers into the cave to fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --a crying Bing Bong in a balloon cage, atop a large moun

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Bing Bong!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Joy?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: There you are.

dialogues.speaker: SHHHHH
dialogues.text: (points) They are standing in front of a giant SLEEPING CLOWN.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (terrified) It’s Jangles.

dialogues.speaker: JANGLES
dialogues.text: (talking in his sleep) Who’s the birthday girl, who’s the birthday girl... They gingerly approach Jangles. Joy climbs up to Bing Bon

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Do you have the core memories? He gives her the satchel. Joy holds them close.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: All he cared about was the candy! Joy helps Bing Bong squeeze through, but the balloon-bars make loud twisting noises. Jangles stirs. Joy freezes. Sh stretches them further... Success! Joy and Bing Bong hurry down and the trio rush a

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're out of here! Let’s get to that train.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait. The train’s not running. We still have to wake up Riley.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: But how? Joy and Sadness look back at the clown.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Oh no. Together, Joy and Sadness approach Jangles and HONK HIS N His eyes open. He stands. He’s HUGE, towering over them.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (loudly) H-hhey Sadness, did you hear about the p-pahh-party that we’re having?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Ohhhh yeah, yes Joy! Isn’t it a ba- bahh... birthday party? 97.

dialogues.speaker: JANGLES
dialogues.text: Did you say... birthday?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: And there’s going to be cake, and presents and--

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: --and games and balloons--

dialogues.speaker: JANGLES
dialogues.text: (pulls out a giant mallet)

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Okay. Follow us! All three run towards the gate, followed by the giant clo

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nothing like a good scare to wake you up, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards inspect each others’ hats.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay, but it’s my handwriting.

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD DAVE
dialogues.text: No, it isn’t. That’s my handwrit-- I wrote that!

dialogues.speaker: SUBCONSCIOUS GUARD FRANK
dialogues.text: No, but THIS one’s my handwriting-- BASH! Jangles’ mallet smashes through, laughing maniacall Our trio run up the stairs, Jangles close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The UNICORN DREAM is mid-production: a Glitter Dance Part rainbows and sparkles aplenty. The crew is bored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear is practically asleep. 98.  INSIDE OUT 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The set begins to shake. BLAAAM! Jangles crashes in.

dialogues.speaker: JANGLES
dialogues.text: WHO’S THE BIRTHDAY GIRL?!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear SHRIEKS, bashes a button and passes out. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley bolts upright in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The meter reads “AWAKE.” Joy and Sadness do a happy dance

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Come on, let’s go! They bolt, leaving Jangles gleefully demolishing the sets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our trio leap aboard just as the train picks up speed.

dialogues.speaker: JOY SADNESS
dialogues.text: Ha ha! We made it! Whoo-hoo! Ha ha!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Guess who’s on their way to Headquarters?! Joy grabs Sadness and picks her up in celebration.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We are! INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley sitting up in bed after being scared awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger and Disgust come out looking tired, rumpled...  INSIDE OUT 100.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: What is going on?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: He did it again.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: (huddled on the floor) We were at school, and we were naked, and there was a dog, and his back half was chasing him... and then we saw Bing Bong.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: You idiot! It was a DREAM! This is ridiculous, we can’t even get a good night sleep anymore. Time to take action. He goes and gets the Idea Bulb he held up earlier. ANGER (CONT’D) Stupid Mom and Dad. If they hadn't moved us, none of this would've happened. Who’s with me? Fear stammers nervously. Anger looks to Disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's do it. Anger plugs the Idea Bulb in. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley gets the idea. She takes out her computer.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: She took it. There’s no turning back.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: So, how’re we gonna get to Minnesota from here?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Well, why don’t we go to the elephant lot and rent an elephant?  INSIDE OUT 101.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Hey! That sounds nice!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: We're taking the bus, nitwit! INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT On her laptop, Riley pulls up the Transway Bus Lines webs

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: There’s a bus leaving tomorrow. Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: A ticket costs money. How do we get money?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Mom’s purse.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Oh, but I would. Where was it we saw it last? He punches up a memory. It comes up and plays.

dialogues.speaker: GUM MEMORY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tripledent gum will--

dialogues.speaker: NOOOO
dialogues.text: (slams his fist, canceling the memory) It’s downstairs somewhere. Mom and Dad got us into this mess. They can pay to get us out. INT. RILEY’S ROOM - NIGHT Riley's face grows angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train speeds ahead. The trio look out the train door.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: How about this, huh? Isn’t this nice? You can see everything from up here! Look, there's Inductive Reasoning. There's Deja Vu. There's Language Processing! There's Deja Vu. There's Critical Thinking! There's Deja Vu. Hey look at this, guys! Memories! Bing Bong ducks inside the train. Joy looks over to Sadne

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey, that was a good idea. About scaring Riley awake. You’re not so bad.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Nice work. Joy turns to sit on a crate inside the train.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t wait to get the old Riley back. As soon as we get there I’m going to fix this whole mess. Bing Bong looks at a memory.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Whoa. Is this Riley? A RECENT MEMORY: Riley hoisted in the air by her teammate

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She's so big now. She won’t fit in my rocket. How’re we gonna get to the moon?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (taking the memory) Oh, it's that time in the twisty tree, remember? The hockey team showed up and Mom and Dad were there cheering. Look at her, having fun and laughing. I love this one.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Mmm. I love that one too.  INSIDE OUT 103.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Atta girl! Now you're getting it!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah. It was the day the Prairie Dogs lost the big playoff game. Riley missed the winning shot. She felt awful. She wanted to quit. Joy's smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry. I went sad again, didn’t I?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I’1l tell ya what. We’ll keep working on that when we get back. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Okay. Joy puts the memory in the satchel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley sneaks down the stairs. Mom is on the phone in the kitchen with her back to Riley.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (on phone) But I just don’t understand, why did our moving van even go to Texas? Riley spots Mom’s purse on the table.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Multiple customers? Riley opens the purse.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Well, we were promised delivery on the fifth. Uh-huh. Riley takes out Mom’s credit card. She pauses. Is she rea doing this? Suddenly Mom turns. Riley panics. Mom looks up. Empty room.  INSIDE OUT 104.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (still on phone) Excuse me, isn’t there any way that you can rush it? Riley slips off with the credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train passes crumbling HONESTY ISLAND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honesty Island crashes into the train tracks. Joy, Sadnes and Bing Bong scream. Workers below see the train falling towards them.

dialogues.speaker: LOOK OUT
dialogues.text: The train CRASHES onto the cliffside. It slips towards th edge. Joy struggles to get up, but the floor is pitching.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Hold on! Workers grab Joy, Sadness and Bing Bong just as the train slides off the cliff and drops into the dump below. Joy looks towards Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: That was our way home! We lost another island... what is happening?

dialogues.speaker: WORKER
dialogues.text: Haven't you heard? Riley is running away.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What?! INT. RILEY’S ROOM —- MORNING Riley packs her clothes when her expression changes to wo  INSIDE OUT 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear is driving.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, hang on, guys. Are we really doing this? I mean, this is serious. Anger pushes Fear aside and works the console.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Look. We have no core memories. You want Riley to be happy? Let’s get back to Minnesota and make more. INT. RILEY’S ROOM Riley's worried face goes angry. She packs and exits.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: If we hurry, we can still stop her. (points)

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Family Island. Let’s go! The trio run along the cliff edge towards the last island

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family Island shakes and crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Joy! Joy! It’s too dangerous! We won't make it in time!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: But that’s our only way back! The rumbling causes an END CAP of a nearby shelf to break exposing an open tube. A memory gets sucked up and shot towards Headquarters.  INSIDE OUT 106.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A recall tube!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: We can get recalled! They run towards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley goes to the front door. Mom and Dad are in the kitc

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Have a great day, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: See you after school, monkey.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: We love you! Riley doesn’t respond. She turns and walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family Island rumbles. A LARGE CHUNK of cliff edge breaks behind them, driving Joy and Sadness forward.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Go! Run! RUN! Joy steps into the disconnected TUBE, ready to sail up to Headquarters. Sadness tries to climb in, but there’s not enough room; s jostles, pressing against the satchel. The CORE MEMORIES start to turn blue.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Woah woah! Sadness! (pushing her back) Sadness, stop! You’re hurting Riley! Joy pulls a core memory from the satchel. It is BRIGHT BL but slowly fades back to normal.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Oh no, I did it again...  INSIDE OUT 107.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: If you get in here, these core memories will get sad! Joy watches FAMILY ISLAND crumble. She looks down at Sadn Joy, pained, decides.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Riley needs to be happy. She pulls the tube closed and starts up alone. Sadness and Bing Bong watch, betrayed and despondent. Joy looks guilt-ridden, but looks on towards Headquarters Suddenly, the cliffside rumbles. Joy’s tube BREAKS. Joy

dialogues.speaker: FALLS
dialogues.text: Bing Bong runs forward to help her, but the ground beneat him crumbles away. Joy and Bing Bong tumble into the abyss.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Joy!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks off into the fog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy falls, clutching the satchel of core memories. She lands hard, rolling down a hill of faded memories. Sh sits up, looks around. The satchel! All the memories are still there. Panicked, Joy runs up the hills of memories. Off in another part of the dump, Bing Bong comes to.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Joy? Bing Bong notices his hand beginning to fade. He gasps.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joy! He finds Joy desperately clawing her way up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Joy? Joy, what are you doing? Will you stop it please? Joy ignores him; keeps trying.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you get it, Joy? We’re stuck down here. We’re forgotten. This stops Joy. All around, memories are fading to dust. Vapors blowing in the atmosphere, they disappear.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We used to play tag and stuff. Joy recognizes this. She finds Sadness’ BLUE CORE MEMORY: Riley crying in class.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: But everything’s different now since we moved. Seeing Riley cry breaks Joy’s heart. She falls to her kne She picks up a nearby MEMORY of young happy Riley colorin

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Do you remember how she used to stick her tongue out when she was coloring? Another memory: Riley talking to a bug.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I could listen to her stories all day. Another memory: Riley spinning.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just wanted Riley to be happy. And now... She holds the recent blue memory of Riley in class. Joy h them all until the memories fall out of her arms. Joy cries. A long, deep, painful cry. Joy has lost everything. Around her, memories fade and disappear. A tear falls onto the faded TWISTY-TREE MEMORY. Joy wipes 108.  INSIDE OUT 109. In wiping the tear, the memory rewinds. Its color CHANGES from GOLD TO BLUE. IN THE MEMORY: Riley sits in the tree with her parents, t team approaching in the distance. Joy looks closer. What's this? She rewinds more. IN THE MEMORY: Riley sits in the tree, crying, alone. Joy remembers what Sadness said about the memory...

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was the day the Prairie Dogs lost the big playoff game. Riley missed the winning shot. She felt awful. She wanted to quit. IN THE MEMORY: Mom and Dad come to console Riley. Joy fast forwards. IN THE MEMORY: The hockey team lifts Riley on their shoul and cheers. Riley smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness. Mom and Dad, the team... they came to help because of Sadness. She turns to Bing Bong, ready to take action.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have to get back up there!

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Joy, we're stuck down here. We might as well be on another planet.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (getting an idea) Another planet. (sings) Who’s your friend who likes to play? Silence.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sings louder) Who’s your friend who likes to play?  INSIDE OUT 110.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: (understanding; excited) His rocket makes you yell "Hooray!" Far off, BING BONG’S ROCKET answers. They run towards it.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who's the best in every way and wants to sing this song to say, who's your friend who likes to play? Bing Bong Bing Bong! Joy and Bing Bong find the rocket!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They perch the wagon atop a hill. Joy looks resigned.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hop in! Both inside, Bing Bong pushes off. They speed down a slop gain momentum, singing all the way. They reach the bottom shoot up another hill, launching up towards the cliff top Joy and Bing Bong enthusiastically, if not desperately, s at the top of their lungs. Not even close. They crash back to the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: c'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shoot down a taller hill for another go. They SING faster and louder. Joy reaches for the ledge but they fall with a thud. Bing Bong stands. There’s no way they’ll make it. He look up at the ledge and then to his hand -- it’s disappearing

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Come on, Joy. One more time. I’ve got a feeling about this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurdling down the largest hill yet, they continue to sing Bing Bong’s song.  INSIDE OUT 111.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Louder! Louder, Joy! Sing louder! Bing Bong times it just right... and jumps out of the wag Without his weight, the Joy gains momentum. She’s unaware Bing Bong’s absence.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: We’re gonna make it! The rocket makes it over the ledge! It crashes atop the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Woohoo! Bing Bong, we did it! We-- She turns around. She’s alone.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bing Bong? Bing Bong! She runs to the cliff side. Below, Bing Bong laughs excitedly, happy to help Riley in the only way he can.

dialogues.speaker: BING BONG
dialogues.text: Ya ha ha! You made it! Ha ha! Go! Go save Riley! (pause) Take her to the moon for me. Okay? He waves as the last of him vanishes into the air. Joy’s widen in awe; he’s sacrificed his life for her.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I'll try, Bing Bong. I promise. Joy gets up and soldiers on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad walk in.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: We're home! Riley? Riley!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad opens the door. The room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I‘1l call her cell.  INSIDE OUT 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks through a sketchy part of the city.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: This is terrible. Wait. Is that someone walking towards us? Let’s cross the street. Riley’s cell phone rings. MOM is calling.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: It's Mom! She's on to us! Where's my bag? Fear finds a paper bag and breathes into it to calm himse

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Riley needs to get core memories. We keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley ignores the call and walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy runs through the Long-Term Memory stacks.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness! She sees Family Island rumble, pieces beginning to break She frantically continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks into the bus depot.  INSIDE OUT 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy runs through a long corridor.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness? Sadness? (no answer; desperate) C’mon Sadness, where are you? Okay. If I were Sadness, where would I be? Joy slumps to the ground. She kicks a leg up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Sadness voice) Ohhh... everything is awful and my legs don’t work and you have to drag me around while I touch all the-- Joy stops. Something has caught her eye. REVEAL: a path of blue memories on the bottom shelves. Joy follows the path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks out of the bus depot and into the advancing l Her cell phone rings again: “Mom.”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear breathes faster into his paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Oh no. It’s Mom again. What do we do?!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Uh... Uh... Boom! Family Island rumbles behind them. QUICK INTERCUTS between the line getting shorter, Riley declining Mom’s call, and Family Island crumbling. Finall

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear’s bag POPS.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: This is madness! She shouldn’t run away!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Let’s get this idea out of her head. They rush to unplug the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy runs, following the path of blue memories.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness! Joy rounds a corner and spots Sadness far down the next r

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sadness! Sadness turns around.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Joy? Inexplicably, Sadness turns and runs away.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait, Sadness! Joy chases after her. Sadness doesn’t stop.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Just let me go! Riley’s better off without me! Joy follows Sadness straight into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness topples giant french fries in Joy's path.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Come back! Joy uses a super-long fry to vault over the mound of frie 114.  INSIDE OUT 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two MIND WORKER COPS are questioning a CLOUD WITNESS.

dialogues.speaker: MIND WORKER COP
dialogues.text: So you're saying your husband was blown away by an elephant. The Cloud Witness nods. Sadness runs past the crime scene They don’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: MIND WORKER COP
dialogues.text: Was he with anyone?

dialogues.speaker: CLOUD WITNESS
dialogues.text: Yes! And there she is! Joy runs right through the Cloud Witness, dissipating her

dialogues.speaker: MIND WORKER COP
dialogues.text: (runs after Joy) Hey! Come back here!

dialogues.speaker: MIND WORKER COP
dialogues.text: Forget it, Jake. It’s Cloud Town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy searches for Sadness. Suddenly, rain falls on her. Ab Sadness is floating on a chunk of rain cloud, away from Headquarters.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: What? Sadness!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: (crying) I only make everything worse!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Wait-- Sadness! We've gotta get you back to... (Sadness is too far away) Ugh. Joy looks back at Family Island crumbling. She looks arou what does she have to work with? The Boyfriend Generator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger tries to untwist the Idea Bulb, but IT WON'T MOVE.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: It’s stuck!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Oh great.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Whadayamean it’s stuck?!?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Now what? A strange BLACKNESS spreads over the console.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Oh, no, no, no. What is THIS?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley boards the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger slams a chair down on the console. It bounces off w no effect. Fear lunges in with a crowbar. He loses contro and it smacks him in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks down the aisle of the bus.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Oh, how do we stop it?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: I got it! Make her feel scared! That’ll make her change her mind!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Brilliant!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: I know it’s brilliant. Do it! Fear frantically pushes buttons.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Ahh! Nothing’s working! Why isn’t it working??

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Let me try! Disgust and Fear pound on the console buttons.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Great, you broke it!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: No, I didn’t!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Let me do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By now, the console is mostly black.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Guys. We can’t make Riley feel anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley sits on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: What have we done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy runs up to Riley’s Imaginary Boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hey! Hey, look at me. Did you mean what you said before? 117.  INSIDE OUT 118.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGINARY BOYFRIEND
dialogues.text: I would die for Riley! I would die for Riley!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, okay, Haircut. Time to prove it. Joy scoops him into her satchel. She activates the genera Imaginary Boyfriends pour out, directly into Joy’s satche

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy spots Sadness ahead, and runs past her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy pulls a balloon free from a TWISTY BALLOON PALM TREE. aims it towards the approaching Sadness and unties it. PTHHPT! The balloon blows Sadness back over the MEMORY DU In the process, the HOUSE OF CARDS behind them collapses.

dialogues.speaker: HOUSE OF CARDS WORKER
dialogues.text: (angry) That’s it! I fold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy sprints by grabbing the SATCHEL, now full of boyfrien

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness floats out over the Memory Dump. Joy runs along t cliff edge, parallel to Sadness, towards Family Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy sights Sadness and aligns herself with Family Island. dumps the satchel, pouring out the Boyfriends. Their mome pulls her to the top of a TOWER OF BOYFRIENDS.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: (to herself) This is crazy, this is crazy... No, no, no! Joy! Be positive. (beat) I am POSITIVE this is crazy!  INSIDE OUT 119. Joy spots the trampoline on Family Island, then Sadness floating away. She times it...

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now! The tower tips forward.

dialogues.speaker: IMAGINARY BOYFRIENDS
dialogues.text: For Riley! Joy falls towards Family Island, bounces on the TRAMPOLIN flying up towards Sadness. She intercepts Sadness midair.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Gotcha!

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Joy?

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Hang on! They launch towards Headquarters. Will they make it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anger, Fear and Disgust watch the screen, worried.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Ohhh, I wish Joy was here! SPLAT! Joy and Sadness hit the back window and slide down grabbing the window edge. The Emotions run to the window.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: It's Joy!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Stand back! Arrrrgh! Anger throws a chair at the window. It bounces off.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: (sarcastically) That worked.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Well, what would you do, if you’re so smart?! He’s smoldering. Disgust’s eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: I’d tell you, but you’re too dumb to understand.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Of course your tiny brain is confused. Guess I'll just have to dumb it down to your level. Sorry I don’t speak “moron” as well as you, but let me try: Duuuuhhhhh. Anger explodes, bursting into full blowtorch flames. Disg sporting a welding mask, picks him up and blows a hole in window. Joy and Sadness climb through. Anger Fear and Disgust all talk at the same time, explain

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Oh, thank goodness you’re back.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Things are really messed up.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: We found this idea, and now Riley’s on a bus heading for Minnesota! Joy looks at the screen. ON THE SCREEN: Riley stares vacantly out the bus window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus starts to pull away.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Joy, you've got to fix this. Get up there.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Sadness, it’s up to you.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Me? Joy pushes Sadness towards the console.  INSIDE OUT 121.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER/FEAR/DISGUST
dialogues.text: Sadness?!?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I can’t, Joy.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Yes you can. Riley needs you. Sadness looks at Joy. Really? Joy nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus pulls out onto the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness approaches the console and takes charge.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Okay. She grips the Idea Bulb. The console is now completely bl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus is on the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness works... and ejects the Idea Bulb. The blackness retracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling comes back to Riley: her expression changes from listless to sad. She stands.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Wait! Stop! I wanna get off. The bus stops. Riley runs to the front and out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley runs away from the bus.  INSIDE OUT 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Emotions watch the screen in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley runs back towards home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom sits at the table, on the phone. Dad hovers.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: (on phone) Alright. Thank you. We will. (to Dad) Her teacher hasn’t even seen Riley all day.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: What? I can't believe this.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: What was she wearing last? Do you even remember what-- The door opens. Riley walks in. They rush over to her.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Riley!

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Riley, there you are! Thank goodness!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh, we were worried sick! Where have you been? It’s so late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness drives. Joy walks to her, holding the golden core memories. She hands them over to Sadness. The core memories turn BLUE. Sadness places one in the recall unit.

dialogues.speaker: THE MEMORY PLAYS ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Young Riley and young Meg walk side by side.  INSIDE OUT 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley remembers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadness places another blue memory in the recall unit.

dialogues.speaker: MEMORIES PLAY ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: Young Riley makes cookies with Mom and Dad. Riley runs ar with underpants on her head, Dad chasing. Riley scores he first goal. Riley skates with Mom and Dad. Sadness places her hand on the console. It turns BLUE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley cries.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: I know you don’t want me to but... I miss home. I miss Minnesota. Mom and Dad, concerned, listen quietly.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You need me to be happy, but... I want my old friends, and my hockey team... I wanna go home. Please don’t be mad.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh sweetie...

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: We’re not mad. You know what? I miss Minnesota too. I miss the woods where we took hikes.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: And the back yard where you used to play.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Spring Lake, where you learned to skate. Riley cries harder.

dialogues.speaker: DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come here.  INSIDE OUT 124. He pulls Riley towards them. The three hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy steps forward with one more gift for Sadness: the blu core memory. Sadness pulls Joy by the hand and places it on the consol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in an embrace, Riley smiles through her tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BING! Joy and Sadness hear the sound of a new memory bein produced. It’s a NEW CORE MEMORY: BLUE AND GOLD, swirled together. A first. The Emotions react in awe. The memory travels down the track and into the holder. A lightline extends out the back of Headquarters. It is a n FAMILY ISLAND, bigger than before. Joy and Sadness turn back to the console together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley, Mom and Dad embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the screen, Joy rests her head on Sadness. They’ team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see many new, multicolored core memories in the Core Memory Holder. The Emotions admire the new Islands of Personality.

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m liking this new view.  INSIDE OUT 125.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Friendship Island has expanded. Glad they finally opened that Friendly Arguments section.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: I like Tragic Vampire Romance Island.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Fashion Island. Everyone shut up!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Boy Band Island. Hope that's just a phase.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Say what you want, I think it’s all beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: WORKER FRITZ
dialogues.text: Alright! The Emotions turn to see workers at a new, larger console

dialogues.speaker: WORKER FRITZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go. Your new expanded console is up and running. The new console lights up.

dialogues.speaker: JOY/SADNESS/FEAR/ANGER/DISGUST
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Cool. Upgrade!

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Ooohh. Fear leans on the console. BEEP!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Hey! Whoa! Whoops, wait. Did I just do that?

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: (re: a warning light label) Hey guys? What’s “pub-er-ty?”

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s probably not important.  INSIDE OUT 126.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Whoa. I have access to the entire Curse Word Library! This new console is the sh--

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: Sorry. I did it again. My bad.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: (pointing to screen) They're getting to the rink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same rink Riley left before. The Golden Gate gleams i the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pep talk from Riley’s parents. We don’t see their faces

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Now when you get out there, you be aggressive!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I know, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: -- but not too aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: You know, you guys don’t have to come to every game. REVEAL: Mom and Dad’s faces are painted blue and green.

dialogues.speaker: DAD
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I’m not missing one! GO FOGHORNS!

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I gotta go. Riley walks away, mortified, as Dad makes foghorn noises.  INSIDE OUT 127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Emotions at the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Awww...

dialogues.speaker: FEAR
dialogues.text: They love us!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mom and Dad are pretty cool.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST
dialogues.text: Guys, of course they are. But we can’t SHOW IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zoom in to Dad’s head... INT. DAD’S HEADQUARTERS Dad’s Emotions cheer. They all have their faces painted. ON THE SCREEN: Mom beams at Dad.

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S FEAR
dialogues.text: She loved the face painting!

dialogues.speaker: DAD'S ANGER
dialogues.text: Ha! Told you it was a great idea! Dad turns to Mom. She smiles, and we zoom in to her head. INT. MOM’S HEADQUARTERS All Mom’s Emotions are also painted. MOM’S ANGER Best idea he’s had in awhile. MOM’S SADNESS He’s a really good guy. They all sigh. Mom’s Anger tosses the MEMORY of the Brazi helicopter pilot. Mom’s Fear retrieves it. MOM’S FEAR Just in case.  INSIDE OUT 128.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley walks towards the ice and bumps into A TEEN BOY. He drops his water bottle. She picks it up for him.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Oh. Sorry! She smiles. ZOOM IN TO THE BOY’S HEAD. INT. BOY’S HEADQUARTERS A dirty, chaotic room. Stuff everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: WARNING LIGHTS ARE BLARING. His Emotions run around in a panic, screaming. One of them is HUDDLED, CRYING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boy stands stunned, unable to speak. Riley hands him water bottle.

dialogues.speaker: RILEY
dialogues.text: Uhh... Ooooo-kay. Bye! Riley skates out onto the ice, looking back over her shoulder... with a hint of a smile?

dialogues.speaker: HOCKEY TEAMMATE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All set, Riley? She HIGH-FIVES a new teammate. They skate into position a Mom and Dad cheer from the stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joy and Sadness stand side by side at the new console, flanked by the others.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: You ready?

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS
dialogues.text: Yeah!  INSIDE OUT 129.

dialogues.speaker: JOY
dialogues.text: Alright. Let's play some hockey! We ZOOM OUT of Riley's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riley faces off. The puck drops.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All right Anger, take it!

dialogues.speaker: ANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Give us that puck or you’re dead meat! Riley gets it!

dialogues.speaker: FEAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: On our left! On our left! An opponent steals the puck.

dialogues.speaker: DISGUST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Let’s just try not to get all smelly this time.

dialogues.speaker: SADNESS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hooh, Mom and Dad are watching us fail.

dialogues.speaker: ANGER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not today! Riley regains the puck and skates off with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: JOY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We've been through a lot lately, that’s for sure. But we still love our girl. She has great new friends, a great new house... things couldn't be better! After all, Riley’s 12 now. What could happen? THE END.
